name: Jukebox Jury Quiz | Best and Worst Lists | 10 Questions

questions.text:
(These songs appeared in the UK Channel 4 Television "100 Worst Pop Records" chart 2003, as voted by the viewers)

Which of these female groups inflicted the song "Wannabe" upon the music loving public?
questions.explanation:
Spice Girls.

	"Wannabe" was a hit for the Spice Girls in 1996. A US and UK #1 single, it was voted #27 in the Channel 4 Television "100 Worst Pop Records" chart.

questions.text:
Here, according to Channel 4 viewers, is another criminal record.
"(Everything I Do) I Do it for You".
But who did it?
questions.explanation:
Bryan Adams.

	This track featured in the film "Robin Hood Prince of Thieves" starring Kevin Costner. Bryan Adams had a marathon chart run in the UK with "(Everything I Do) I Do it for You" in 1991. It featured in the "Worst 100" chart at #14.

questions.text: They had us all doing the "Macarena" - but who were guilty party.
questions.explanation:
Los Del Rio.

	Los Del Rio brought us this dance craze tune in 1996. Now it just drives us cRaZy! The "Macarena" features in the "Worst 100" at #37.

questions.text:
Exhibit A in this case is a track called "Ebony and Ivory". 
Do you know the culprits?
questions.explanation:
Paul McCartney and Stevie Wonder.

	This track, which has failed to pass the test of time, was a hit for the dynamic duo in 1982. It was voted #93 in the "Worst 100".

questions.text:
She pleaded with us to "Believe" her statement in 1998.
Which member of this line-up is the guilty party?
questions.explanation:
Cher.

	Voted into the Channel 4 "Worst 100" at #36, Cher had a US and UK chart topper with "Believe" in 1998.

questions.text:
This track was a criminal act by an actor.
A re-make of of the Beatles song "Lucy in the Sky with Diamonds". 
But who is culpable of this musical mayhem?
questions.explanation:
William Shatner.

	William Shatner, "Star Trek's" Captain Kirk, should turn his phasor on this one. Well, that's the view of the record buying public."Lucy in the Sky with Diamonds" was written by John Lennon and Paul McCartney.

questions.text: "Lucky" was the title, but who subjected the music loving public to this track?
questions.explanation:
Britney Spears.

	This year 2000 hit for Britney Spears was voted #34 on the "Worst 100" chart.

questions.text:
He sang "I'd Do Anything For Love (But I Won't Do That)". 
But who shouldn't have done that?
questions.explanation:
Meat Loaf.

	Meat Loaf has produced many classic tracks, but the record buying public doesn't think this 1993 track is one of them. "I'd Do Anything For Love (But I Won't Do That)" features in the "Worst 100" at #62.

questions.text:
"American Pie" has been a hit for Don Mclean and Madonna. 
But which version did the jury of Channel 4 viewers consider to be dodgy goods?
questions.explanation:
Madonna.

	Originally a hit for Don McLean in 1972. The jury decided that Madonna's version of "American Pie" is guilty of bad taste, voting it in at #81 in the "Worst 100".

questions.text:
Our final case occurred in "MacArthur Park". 
But who stands in the dock accused for this offence?
questions.explanation:
Richard Harris.

	This song was a hit for actor Richard Harris in 1968. "MacArthur Park" was voted #90 in the "Worst 100" (Data used in this quiz comes from the UK Channel 4 Television "100 Worst Pop Records", voted by viewers in 2003) PS. I did not vote in this poll, so don't send me hate mail if your favourite track appears here!
